meanings.definition: To make healthy, whole, or sound again.
meanings.sent1: She used a bandage to heal her cut.
meanings.sent2: The medicine helped heal his illness.
meanings.sent3: The magical ointment could heal any wound instantly.
meanings.sent4: Time has the power to heal even the deepest emotional scars.
meanings.sent5: The healing power of nature can be truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To cure or restore to health.
meanings.sent1: The doctor worked hard to heal the patient's sickness.
meanings.sent2: Her warm soup always seemed to heal colds quickly.
meanings.sent3: A hug from a loved one can sometimes heal more than any medicine.
meanings.sent4: Laughter has the ability to heal the soul in ways we cannot explain.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music seemed to heal his troubled mind.

meanings.definition: To become healthy or sound again.
meanings.sent1: With proper care, the plant will heal and grow strong.
meanings.sent2: After resting, her ankle started to heal.
meanings.sent3: The old house seemed to heal itself with each passing season.
meanings.sent4: The community came together to heal after the natural disaster.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy miraculously began to heal on its own.
